byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Surt, and Adam Nossiter reported from Benghazi, Libya. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Volunteers in Surt, Libya, remove bodies of people apparently killed in reprisal by anti-Qaddafi militias; several of the victims were wearing fatigues, and many of their hands were bound behind their back; volunteers speculate that victims were patients at city's main hospital who were detained when the former rebels captured it.
snippet: Throughout the conflict, Libya’s interim leaders have shown themselves to be unwilling or incapable of looking into accusations of atrocities by their fighters, including an apparent recent massacre.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Throughout the conflict, Libya’s interim leaders have shown themselves to be unwilling or incapable of looking into accusations of atrocities by their fighters, including an apparent recent massacre.

headline.main: In Libya, Massacre Site Is Cleaned Up, Not Investigated
headline.print_headline: In Libya, Massacre Site Is Cleaned Up, Not Investigated
headline.seo: In Libya, Surt Massacre Site Is Not Investigated
